channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description:
I feel bad, because I’m only the third sucker to fall for this. I was hoping to be the first. https://t.co/ZrdAMAmITm

I spent $20 in service of this joke because of 3 transactions I didn’t fully understand the implications of. 4th time’s the charm! I’m totally OK with that, since I’m still up from my tiny initial “investment” in ETH.
item.source:markdown:
I feel bad, because I’m only the third sucker to fall for this. I was hoping to be the first. https://t.co/ZrdAMAmITm
I spent $20 in service of this joke because of 3 transactions I didn’t fully understand the implications of. 4th time’s the charm! I’m totally OK with that, since I’m still up from my tiny initial “investment” in ETH.

item.description: @joshtpm This is the disease that we can get even if vaccinated, which shreds our lungs and causes permanent brain damage, not to mention increases the risk of many health conditions, that we’ll get over and over until it ultimately kills us, correct?
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm This is the disease that we can get even if vaccinated, which shreds our lungs and causes permanent brain damage, not to mention increases the risk of many health conditions, that we’ll get over and over until it ultimately kills us, correct?

item.description:
He’s taking it for him, and she’s taking it for Instagram. https://t.co/qawYC3a1xO

In a previous relationship, my then-girlfriend gave me carte blanche to take candids of her, but it felt like the pressure to take a good shot was too high, so I only took two or three.

(I 100% put the pressure on myself. I was never asked to take a good shot. It was just something I thought I had to do.)
item.source:markdown:
He’s taking it for him, and she’s taking it for Instagram. https://t.co/qawYC3a1xO
In a previous relationship, my then-girlfriend gave me carte blanche to take candids of her, but it felt like the pressure to take a good shot was too high, so I only took two or three.
(I 100% put the pressure on myself. I was never asked to take a good shot. It was just something I thought I had to do.)

item.description:
I’m continuing to make chicken chow mein. Here’s attempt #2. This was a couple of weeks ago and the chicken was about just about right. https://t.co/O4hfRDsBPR

Most recipes call for oyster sauce and up until tonight’s third attempt (straight to leftovers), I substituted fish sauce (from my forays in making chicken curry noodle).
item.source:markdown:
I’m continuing to make chicken chow mein. Here’s attempt #2. This was a couple of weeks ago and the chicken was about just about right. https://t.co/O4hfRDsBPR
Most recipes call for oyster sauce and up until tonight’s third attempt (straight to leftovers), I substituted fish sauce (from my forays in making chicken curry noodle).

item.description:
The bok choy pattern Hawaiian shirt is real, and it’s spectacular. https://t.co/aRxLQnhB4Q

20 minutes out the door with it on and I got my first “Hey, nice shirt!”

I’m wearing it to work tomorrow.

This was the best I could do to set up a Garden State bathroom scene photo with my bok choy pattern Hawaiian shirt at the co-working space. https://t.co/gdv2wtpJz1 https://t.co/aWuEJW3r0k
item.source:markdown:
The bok choy pattern Hawaiian shirt is real, and it’s spectacular. https://t.co/aRxLQnhB4Q
20 minutes out the door with it on and I got my first “Hey, nice shirt!”
I’m wearing it to work tomorrow.

item.description: OH: “Mortality is not safe for work.”
item.source:markdown: OH: “Mortality is not safe for work.”

item.description:
Whenever I see photos of someone at a food festival or a food court and all the food they ate, I assume they only took one or two bites, since it’s almost always an incredible amount of food that one person can’t possibly eat on their own. https://t.co/UJ0Tpoyj0u

I also think: “Should I bother going? I’ve had a pretty good experience just looking at the photos of of the food.”

I think the same thing when I see people posting their travel photos. “Why bother going now? I’m just going to see the same things I already saw.”
item.source:markdown:
Whenever I see photos of someone at a food festival or a food court and all the food they ate, I assume they only took one or two bites, since it’s almost always an incredible amount of food that one person can’t possibly eat on their own. https://t.co/UJ0Tpoyj0u
I also think: “Should I bother going? I’ve had a pretty good experience just looking at the photos of of the food.”
I think the same thing when I see people posting their travel photos. “Why bother going now? I’m just going to see the same things I already saw.”

item.description: Us Torontonians can put plastic bags in the recycling, just not black plastic of any kind. It’s the main reason I bring a reusable container if I think I’m not going to finish my meal at a restaurant. https://t.co/gcV3wMje0h
item.source:markdown: Us Torontonians can put plastic bags in the recycling, just not black plastic of any kind. It’s the main reason I bring a reusable container if I think I’m not going to finish my meal at a restaurant. https://t.co/gcV3wMje0h

item.description: @Bill2K MLB does recaps (3-4 minute highlight packages) and the 7-8 minute condensed games, and they’re really good, but they’re still never as good as Blue Jays in 30. It feels like something to make time for and eat snacks while watching.
item.source:markdown: @Bill2K MLB does recaps (3-4 minute highlight packages) and the 7-8 minute condensed games, and they’re really good, but they’re still never as good as Blue Jays in 30. It feels like something to make time for and eat snacks while watching.

item.description:
After every Toronto Blue Jays game, Sportsnet (the TV network owned by the same parent company as the baseball team) produces a half-an-hour distillation called Blue Jays in 30. I want that for every event that’s 3 hours or longer.

One downside is you won’t be able to participate in the conversation about it live. Another downside is having to spend a day avoiding spoilers.

I would watch a “2022 Emmys in 30” if NBC produced it. #Emmys2022

I would watch a “Day Of Mourning for Queen Elizabeth II in 30” (for each day of mourning) if someone produced it.

I would have watched a “January 6th Committee Hearing in 30” (for each of the hearings) if the committee had produced them.
item.source:markdown:
After every Toronto Blue Jays game, Sportsnet (the TV network owned by the same parent company as the baseball team) produces a half-an-hour distillation called Blue Jays in 30. I want that for every event that’s 3 hours or longer.
One downside is you won’t be able to participate in the conversation about it live. Another downside is having to spend a day avoiding spoilers.
I would watch a “2022 Emmys in 30” if NBC produced it. #Emmys2022
I would watch a “Day Of Mourning for Queen Elizabeth II in 30” (for each day of mourning) if someone produced it.
I would have watched a “January 6th Committee Hearing in 30” (for each of the hearings) if the committee had produced them.
